title: The number of bots in Co-Op vs. AI is disgusting.
body:
I know there are threads like this already, but I feel like this subject is important and needs a lot more attention, so I'm posting another one.

For the last few months the botting in League of Legends has been getting completely out of hand. First they started showing up almost every game in ARAM, often with all of them on one team. The people who got stuck with the 3 feeding bots just had a terrible game that they had no chance of coming back from, and could do nothing but let the winning team end it quickly. They couldn't even surrender. The people on the winning side had no fun in doing so, because they'd have been in exactly the same circumstance as the enemy team before, and statistically they probably would be again in their next game. It made me give up on playing ARAM altogether and just stick with Co-Op vs. AI.

Now the bots are in Co-Op too. Every single game I've played in the last few weeks has had a minimum of 2 bots, and the last few have had 3-4. They always go mid and feed the enemy laner (usually an AP carry who can 1-shot you when he gets enough kills), to around 10/0 by 6 minutes in. If there are enough real people on the team working together, the fed bot can usually be shut down or the game can be won by split-pushing, but when there are 4 bots on a team against Intermediate AI, the game is an automatic loss – one that you can't even surrender from, or quit without getting leave penalties.

Sometimes you can spot a bot in queue by their name and summoner spells (heal and barrier) and just dodge the game. Usually though, you have no way of being sure until you get to the loading screen and see that they all have the same icon and no keystone mastery. By that point all you can do is exit the client and wait it out, but you're already screwed because you'll just get leave penalties for doing it, and the next Co-Op game you queue for will 100% certainly have bots in it too. If you're like me and decide to go into the game and hope there's at least one other human on your team, then in game the bots will buy boots first and not move until the minions spawn, then start running down mid lane and suiciding to the AI. If you're alone with 4 bots and decide to go AFK, then you get leave penalties. It's a broken system that punishes the ones already being hurt by the botting, and it's a seriously crappy feeling to be left with zero choice other than to simply not play Co-Op anymore.

Every game I report the bots, but the next game I load into has 4 new ones, and again the game after that. There isn't even an easy way to get hard physical proof of the botting to send in online, because the replay feature isn't implemented for that game mode. All I can do is report, and post on the forum, but it feels like nothing comes of it. I suffer through it in hopes that it will get better, but I feel like nothing's being done about it, like Riot just don't care enough to fix the problem. I've been playing this game since 2011, I've kept coming back time and again for new champions and map updates, and I've spent a lot of money on skins and icons... but this is honestly making me not want to play League of Legends at all anymore.

Come on, Riot. Please... end this nonsense.

Simple solution: after discovering a pattern of behavior in-game, upon next death require a captcha of some sort to be solved (in-game, at fountain) with 2 tries. Failing it suspends the account and boots the player out of the game. In other words, if the game detects your swain farm bot running top and doing nothing but auto'ing, it'll trigger the captcha. This should weed out a ton of bots automatically and allow support to deal with some of the more sophisticated ones or post-game reported cases.

I have 2 comments to make:

disregard these comments if you are a smurf(or high level playing low level account)

if you are a new player, do not attempt Ranked until you have an adequate rune page setup for champions that you intend to play.  Runes provide a heavy influence in gameplay and can easily dictate how a lane matchup will progress regardless of skill (though it is a factor)  Learn which lanes and champions benefit from which runes and then proceed to try your luck.
Now I'm here, wondering if I find no bots because I have a good W/L on ARAM or because I play at EUNE.

Probably your region, but it could be your good W/L stats, because then you'll (hopefully) get matched with people who have similar stats.  Or it's just plain luck.

Almost every Co-Op game I play has at least one bot.  But I'm one of the lucky few who's only had a handful of 3-4 bot games AND was playing a champion I can carry with to salvage the mess.  There are people who get dealt a worse hand than that.

Right now it's a lot worse in EUW, I've been playing a lot of bot games with a friend from NA who's trying to level up on both servers, on EU literally every game so far was 3 bots, on NA we've been getting 1 at most.

As for ARAM, MMR plays a big role in this, I've never seen a bot on my main account but there's still tons if your MMR is actually low, it doesn't have to be good to not encounter any though, just not awful.

3 months later: still bots everywhere :)

I honestly don't have a problem with (player) botters in beg. bots, because I can solo carry that 1v5, and in fact, some of my most ridiculous bot matches have been because of (player) bots extending the length of the match and increasing the value of kills on the bots by me.

You still have an item cap though, and when the bots reach theirs and shut you down a couple of times, you will start to feel it. And no, you can't always avoid them because at some point you will have to come back to defend a 4 man pushing team.
I can win a game v 5 beg. bots by myself: 1v5.

Ah, beginner bots, I didn't read that. Intermediate bots, while dumb, have literally inhuman reaction times. The fucking mid laner, especially Annie Bot (not the pro), can usually delete you the second you get in range, on top of their CC combos being perfectly sync. They're still dumb, but if you are careless, you will get destroyed by very precisely chained stuns/knockups/exhausts no matter how fed you are.
Yea, I can see it being annoying in intermediates because they are actually competent enough that you can't just 1v5 them like you're invincible of something, they will punish brazen disrespect.

Last time i played bots the other human in the game openly told me that the 2 bots on our team were his, which is why he wanted me to go to a certain lane and group at a certain point. I guess you can do things like that when Riot is notorious for letting people behave in whatever way they want with rare punishments only in extreme cases.

If no one except you has joined the chat room then you are most likely playing with bots.
